I don't know if this is helpful or not, but my name is Michael Gibbes -- I'm one of the two facilitators for the Video Games and You decal (separate from the design decal). I also know Kevin, who facilitates the decal I think you're talking about.

Basically, you don't need much experience to join, but you do need to have the dedication and passion needed for designing games. There are a ton of different roles (programmers, artists, writers, etc.). As far as I know, the decal is as competitive as other decals (Video Games and You has been getting 60-70 applicants lately per semester, and we only have 30 spots), but you should totally apply for the design decal regardless. :D

Kevin here, Michael got it right. As long as you have completed 61a and 61b (which you have) you should have sufficient programming abilities for the decal. This next semester is only our second semester teaching the decal and we got 70+ applicants for 30 spots last time, we are expecting more applicants this time. We mostly look for enthusiasm for game development and a willingness to commit a lot of time to the course.
